comment: Given three points ` A ` , ` B ` and ` C ` such that ` -. A = B ` , the point ` C ` lies on the line going through ` A ` and ` B ` iff the corresponding signed area is zero. That justifies the usage of signed area as a collinearity indicator. (Contributed by Saveliy Skresanov, 22-Sep-2017.)
